entry.title: AltDrag - 0.9 release candidate 1
entry.content:
Released 0.9 release candidate. This update fixes a number of bugs that were present in the beta, including one major bug if you had the taskbar oriented at a non-default location. It also adds a new feature that allows you to use the mouse wheel to scroll inactive windows. You can enable it by setting InactiveScroll=1 in the settings. For a complete list of changes, see the changelog below. The release candidate is only available as a 7z archive.

I want those of you who have multiple monitors to see if there are any issues. Try obscure configurations. I only own one monitor myself so you can understand that I have troubles testing multi-monitor setups.

Changelog:

  • Added InactiveScroll. Enable it to scroll inactive windows.
  • Fixed major bug with custom taskbar locations (bug only present in the beta).
  • Expanded Aero option.
  • Expanded AutoRemaximized option.
  • It is now possible to toggle the maximized state with a resize button while dragging.

entry.title: AltDrag - 0.9 beta 1
entry.content:
Released 0.9 beta. The biggest new feature is that AltDrag now can mimic the Aero Snap effect in Windows 7. This even works with Windows XP and should work perfectly with multiple monitors! For a complete list of changes, see the changelog below. I expect to release a proper version in January. In any case, I believe that this is the best version of AltDrag yet! The beta is only available as a 7z archive. Please report any bugs that you find!!

Changelog:

  • Added Aero option. Alt-drag windows to the left, right and top side of the screen. Corners work too!
  • Added new mouse actions: AlwaysOnTop and Close.
  • Replaced roll-up behavior with Aero behavior. Double-click with middle/right mouse button.
  • Renamed "stick" to "snap" as people seem to "get" that term better.
  • Fixed some bugs that prevented HookWindows from working properly.
  • Tweaked the blacklist (see wiki).

entry.title: AltDrag - 0.8
entry.content:
Released 0.8.
The new things since the beta are 64-bit support for HookWindows, the ability to configure what keys trigger the alt dragging, the ability to reconfigure what the mouse buttons do. I have fixed a few bugs, most notable: the alt key will no longer trigger the window menu! New language: Russian by Gluek. If you are updating from 0.7, there are a few more things as well, which were described in the last update.

Changelog:
  • Added AutoStick, enable it to make windows always stick without needing to press shift. This replaces StickyScreen.
  • Renamed ExperimentalFeatures to HookWindows, also improved it so resizing is now supported and windows should no longer flicker. 64-bit programs also work now. I no longer consider it experimental!
  • The alt key will no longer activate the window menu!
  • Added the ability to configure what keys should trigger the dragging, resizing, etc.
  • Added the ability to configure what the mouse buttons do. New actions: minimize and center.
  • Improved multi-monitor support a lot.
  • Tweaked the blacklist (see wiki).

entry.title: AltDrag - 0.8 beta 2
entry.content:
Released 0.8 beta 2.
I am releasing this as a beta but it is still the most recommended version available. I have made some major changes and fixes, not to mention a few new features. First of all, I have completely redone the feature previously called ExperimentalFeatures. I renamed it to HookWindows since I no longer consider it experimental and I encourage you to try it out. A few other new things are AutoStick, an improved version of StickyScreen, and RMBMinimize which makes your right mouse button minimize windows. I have also done a lot of fixes to multi-monitor support. New language: Galician by Alexander De Sousa. Users of 0.7 and 0.8b1 won't be automatically notified of this version. I plan to support 64-bit windows with HookWindows for the stable 0.8.

Changelog:
  • Added AutoStick, enable it to make windows always stick without needing to press shift. This replaces StickyScreen.
  • Renamed ExperimentalFeatures to HookWindows, also improved it so resizing is now supported and windows should no longer flicker. I no longer consider it experimental.
  • Added RMBMinimize, enable it to minimize windows with the right mouse button.
  • Improved multi-monitor support a lot.
  • Tweaked the blacklist (see wiki).

entry.title: AltDrag - 0.7
entry.content:
Released 0.7.
This version adds the ability to roll-up windows by double-clicking with the middle mouse button. I've also added a new feature called StickyScreen which makes windows automatically stick to the screen borders without needing shift. This only works with the Alt button unless you enable ExperimentalFeatures.
I have also fixed a few bugs with ExperimentalFeatures, so it's working really well now, give it a try.
In addition to that I've fixed a couple of small bugs, including an error message that sometimes popped up if you had AltDrag on autostart.
I've also updated the installer, so upgrading should be a breeze.
